question.text: Read the statements given below and select the correct option.

options.text: Atrial natriuretic factor (ANF) is responsible for increasing the blood pressure.
Gastrin stimulates the secretion of HCl and trypsinogen.
Erythropoietin is produced by Juxta-Glomerular cells of the kidney.
CCK acts only on the gall bladder.

solution.text:
I. Atrial natriuretic factor (ANF) is a hormone secreted by the atrial wall of the heart. It is responsible for decreasing blood pressure.

II. Gastrin acts on the gastric glands and stimulates the secretion of HCl and pepsinogen.

III. Erythropoietin is produced by juxta glomerular cells of the kidney. It stimulates erythropoiesis.

IV. Cholecystokinin (CCK) acts on the pancreas and gallbladder and stimulates the secretion of pancreatic enzymes and bile juice respectively.
